body:
According to the [onedrive docs for this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/rest-api/resources/hashes#remarks):

> In OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Server 2016, sha1Hash and crc32Hash are not available.
>
> In OneDrive Personal, quickXorHash is not available.

So looks like in OneDrive for Business only [quickXorHash](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/onedrive/developer/code-snippets/quickxorhash) is available.

So rclone could implement that.

At the very least we need to document where the hash is available.  We know at runtime whether it is a business Onedrive or not so we can alter the output from `Hashes` and `Hash`.

@edkedk can you do this for me? I need some test vectors for quickXorHash and I don't currently have access to a onedrive for business account :-(

[test_vectors.zip](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/1926984/test_vectors.zip)

```
unzip test_vectors.zip
rclone copy test_vectors onedrive:test_vectors
rclone size -vv --dump bodies onedrive:test_vectors --log-file test_vectors.log
```

Then zip `test_vectors.log` and attach the zipped version here.  I only need the last response which will be large and full of JSON if you want to edit it for privacy. If you prefer you can email it to me nick@craig-wood.com - Thanks!
Does the .zip contain only an empty directory on purpose?
Thank you very much :-)  I'll have a go at porting the quickXorHash from c# to go.

OK here is my first attempt at adding QuickXorHash to onedrive for business.  It passes all the integration tests so I think it is good to go, but I'd be interested in your testing.

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.40-098-gae03cbe4-quickxorhash/

I think it works perfectly!

```
C:\...3cbe4-quickxorhash-windows-amd64>check d:\test OD5006:Test -vv --checksum
2018/04/20 21:25:38 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.40-098-gae03cbe4-quickxorhash" s
tarting with parameters ["rclone.exe" "check" "d:\\test" "OD5006:Test" "-vv" "--
checksum"]
2018/04/20 21:25:38 DEBUG : Using config file from "C:\\Users\\edk\\.config\\rcl
one\\rclone.conf"
2018/04/20 21:25:39 INFO  : One drive root 'Test': Modify window is 1s
2018/04/20 21:25:39 INFO  : One drive root 'Test': Waiting for checks to finish
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : cpuz-readme.txt: OK
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : cpuz.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : cpuz.ini: OK
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : GPU-Z.0.6.6.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : latency.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:25:40 NOTICE: One drive root 'Test': 0 differences found
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : 5 go routines active
2018/04/20 21:25:40 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.40-098-gae03cbe4-quickxorhash" f
inishing with parameters ["rclone.exe" "check" "d:\\test" "OD5006:Test" "-vv" "-
-checksum"]
```

If I change a file (but not the modification time), I get
```
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : cpuz-readme.txt: OK
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : cpuz.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : cpuz.ini: QuickXorHash = 54d1f773a0160e52ca1247d1420
8820733f049fc (Local file system at \\?\d:\test)
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : cpuz.ini: QuickXorHash = 54d1f773a0160e52ca1247d1420
8820723f049fc (One drive root 'Test')
2018/04/20 21:22:38 ERROR : cpuz.ini: QuickXorHash differ
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : GPU-Z.0.6.6.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:22:38 DEBUG : latency.exe: OK
2018/04/20 21:22:38 NOTICE: One drive root 'Test': 1 differences found
2018/04/20 21:22:38 Failed to check: 1 differences found
```

Many thanks for your quick action!

Excellent!  Thanks for testing.  It is my favourite kind of coding implementing hash functions and other crypto stuff so I couldn't resist staying up late to do it ;-)

I've merged that here

https://beta.rclone.org/v1.40-102-g1a3fb21a/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

and it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) from now on and in the 1.41 release.

issue.title: Can't connect to SharePoint Online team sites such as https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Ive been able to successfully connect to the default https://orgname-my.sharepoint.com/ personal SharePoint Site...

```
$ rclone lsd sp3:
-1 2017-01-04 22:16:34         0 Attachments
-1 2015-01-23 11:13:10         0 Shared with Everyone
```


But Im having difficultly figuring out how to connect to team sites on URLs such a: https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name etc.

The rclone config guided process doesnt let you set the resource_url when setting it up. So Ive tried editing ~/.config/rclone.conf using a few different methods, changing the resource_url and then reauthorizing,  I've tried a number of different addresses like...


For the main/default team site:
```
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/ 
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/Shared Documents
```

For separate team sites, or what Microsoft call "site collections":

```
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name/
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name/Shared Documents
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name/Shared Documents/
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name/Shared%20Documents
https://orgname.sharepoint.com/sites/Site-Name/Shared%20Documents/
```


I'm not sure which address format I'm meant to use? (for either the main team site, or all the other ones under /sites/)

I always get the error:

```
$ rclone -vv lsd sp3:
2017/10/25 03:17:18 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2017/10/25 03:17:18 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.38" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "lsd" "sp3:"]
2017/10/25 03:17:19 Failed to create file system for "sp3:": failed to get root: 401 Unauthorized: 
```
(there's nothing after that last colon)

Does anyone know how I access team SharePoint sites?

My rclone version is:
```
rclone v1.38
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.9
```
...on Manjaro 64bit, installed from the distro's repos.

I'm choosing the "business" option when asked in `rclone config`.

body:
Hi~

I use win7+rclone 64b v1.43

I just wanna rclone check g-suite:/folder1 vs onedrive-business:/folder1

And got that "hash could not be checked" for the ondrive-business.

I googled for rclone and read that for onedrive-business, only quickXorHash is available
and the post directed me here.

As I am already using v1.43, isn't 2 posts above said this is implemented?

thanks.

some text that direct me here:
========================================
ncw
Apr 18
I just found the onedrive docs for this:

In OneDrive for Business and SharePoint Server 2016, sha1Hash and crc32Hash are not available.

In OneDrive Personal, quickXorHash is not available.

So looks like in OneDrive for Business only quickXorHash 4 is available.

So rclone could implement that.

It is definitely worth making an issue about this. If nothing else it needs to say this in the docs 1




edk
Apr 19
Thank you for unearthing this. I just submitted an issue on github - I hope I did that correctly, because its the first time I used github.




ncw
Apr 19
Thanks! For future people looking at this thread: https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2262 15 is the issue.

@ccchan234 The problem is that QuickXorHash is Microsoft only; GDrive doesn't have it. I think these two lines from the manual may help you:

```
If you supply the --size-only flag, it will only compare the sizes not the hashes as well.  Use this for a quick check.
If you supply the --download flag, it will download the data from both remotes and check them against each other on the fly.
    This can be useful for remotes that don't support hashes or if you really want to check all the data.
```

> @ccchan234 The problem is that QuickXorHash is Microsoft only; GDrive doesn't have it. I think these two lines from the manual may help you:
> 
> ```
> If you supply the --size-only flag, it will only compare the sizes not the hashes as well.  Use this for a quick check.
> If you supply the --download flag, it will download the data from both remotes and check them against each other on the fly.
>     This can be useful for remotes that don't support hashes or if you really want to check all the data.
> ```

Hi~
my problem:
paranoid that gdrive could dead due to terrorist/hardware failure/my admin eror etc.

my solution:
rclone them to onedrive, 5TB by 5TB.

of course after rclone copy, I need to VERIFY the checksum.

problem now:
onedrive dunt support checksum calculation....

solution:
I just learnt to use "rclone mount" to mount onedrive as a drive. (u could use win10 and onedrive on demand, but it's NA for me who using win7).
Then use beyond compare or other software to verify the checksum manually.
Yest that would be terrible because say beyond compare need to dnld both and calculate checksum.

But for this moment, to protect me from google drive failure (seems happen before?).
This is my cheapest and readily solution.

Thanks all. Thanks author of rclone and others.
